title: Incorrect suggestion for struct-like enum variant

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-invalid-suggestion
labels.description: A structured suggestion resulting in incorrect code

body:
```rust
enum MyEnum {
    EscapeSequence { sequence: String }
}

fn main() {
    let x: MyEnum = String::from("hello");
}
```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=672b817655da70313711c7bc908c6e56))

Errors:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/main.rs:6:21
  |
6 |     let x: MyEnum = String::from("hello");
  |            ------   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |            |        |
  |            |        expected enum `MyEnum`, found struct `std::string::String`
  |            |        help: try using a variant of the expected enum: `MyEnum::EscapeSequence(String::from("hello"))`
  |            expected due to this

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.
error: could not compile `playground`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.

```
